case_vignette: A 7-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents because of concerns about his behavior at school over the past year. He often leaves his seat and runs around the classroom, and has a hard time waiting for his turn. His teacher is also concerned. His behavior is a little better at home, but he frequently acts out inappropriately. The boy was born at 39 weeks' gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery. He is up to date on all vaccines and is meeting all developmental milestones. He has never had a serious illness and takes no medications. At the physician’s office, the boy wanders around the exam room during the examination. He does not seem to listen to directions and talks incessantly.
question: Which  elements in the boy's history is most consistent with the likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I often run around the classroom, can't wait for my turn, and I act out inappropriately at home sometimes.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 7-year-old boy.
Have you had any medical issues or illnesses in the past?
No, I've never had a serious illness.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
No, I take no medications.
Do you have any family history of ADHD or other behavioral disorders?
I'm sorry, but I don't have information about my family's medical history.
Final Diagnosis: ADHD (Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder)
